critique: This document is a short executive order regarding the appointment of Charles Gallagher to a position in the Post Office Department. It waives civil service rules for this appointment, based on the recommendation of the Postmaster General. There is not enough information to assess its stance on ideological tilt, immigration, federalism, national security vs. civil liberties, economic regulation, or social inclusion. The only axis with a clear signal is executive power, as it expands the executive's ability to bypass standard hiring procedures.
